body_html: @zou3519 in the event that we were calling contiguous() on a tensor that was already contiguous (but which might not be the case if we execute the trace with different inputs later), we would skip the clone() call and just return the original tensor. This is incorrect under tracing for the reason stated--we need to trace the computation under full generality and skip these micro-optimizations

body: @zou3519 in the event that we were calling `contiguous()` on a tensor that was already contiguous (but which might not be the case if we execute the trace with different inputs later), we would skip the `clone()` call and just return the original tensor. This is incorrect under tracing for the reason stated--we need to trace the computation under full generality and skip these micro-optimizations
